posts.post_content:
Its funny, when I first start playing magic and I got this in a booster pack I felt jipped of a rare. So I sold it to a local gaming store and to my surprise they were offering 8 or so dollars for it. It wasn't until later that I realized the actual utility this card actually has of double landfall, tutoring for any mountain or island, and deck thinning.  
  
Heck since its blue one of my favorite things to do is cast [Brainstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brainstorm) then pop this sucker to shuffle my library.

Posted By: EvilCleavage (8/2/2010 10:02:10 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I'll admit, I didn't like the fetchlands when I first saw them, but after running a few in EDH to fix my mana, I'm a believer. In my Rafiq deck, I run all the fetches that I have that apply: Arid Mesa, Marsh Flats, Misty Rainforest, and an old Flood Plain. With a Savannah and a Temple Garden (can't find Tundra/ Hallowed Fountain anywhere, or even a Windswept Heath), the lands often fix for multiple colours while thinning the deck. One life is well worth this.
posts.html:
I'll admit, I didn't like the fetchlands when I first saw them, but after running a few in EDH to fix my mana, I'm a believer. In my Rafiq deck, I run all the fetches that I have that apply: Arid Mesa, Marsh Flats, Misty Rainforest, and an old Flood Plain. With a Savannah and a Temple Garden (can't find Tundra/ Hallowed Fountain anywhere, or even a Windswept Heath), the lands often fix for multiple colours while thinning the deck. One life is well worth this.

Posted By: MICKEY.KNOX (3/23/2013 1:08:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Ah, I love the {UR} love this set gave us. The opportunity to fetch [Volcanic Island](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Volcanic Island), [Mountain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mountain), [Steam Vents](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steam Vents), or Basic [Island](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Island) is more powerful than you think.  
  
Counterburn, Grixis Control, Combo ([Pyromancer's Swath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyromancer's Swath), [Dragonstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragonstorm), [Past in Flames](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Past in Flames)), are all very powerful decks for their formats.  
  
This was the only good form of mana-fixing besides [Preordain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Preordain) available to my [Neurok Commando](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Neurok Commando) burn deck, and it worked wonders over [Terramorphic Expanse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terramorphic Expanse) and [Evolving Wilds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Evolving Wilds), although I obviously ran a couple of those too for good measure.
posts.html:
Ah, I love the {UR} love this set gave us. The opportunity to fetch Volcanic Island, Mountain, Steam Vents, or Basic Island is more powerful than you think.

Counterburn, Grixis Control, Combo (Pyromancer's Swath, Dragonstorm, Past in Flames), are all very powerful decks for their formats.

This was the only good form of mana-fixing besides Preordain available to my Neurok Commando burn deck, and it worked wonders over Terramorphic Expanse and Evolving Wilds, although I obviously ran a couple of those too for good measure.
